response.answer_text: Unlimited broadband has two aspects : (i) Internet provider company is providing internet without maximum limit of data (in terms of GB) to be drawn in a month without throttling down the speed (in terms of Mbps or Kbps). (ii) Internet provider company provides a certain limit of data (in terms of GB) in a month at high speed and after the prescribed limit is exhausted then the speed of internet is reduced and consumer can use the internet at low speed without any maximum ceiling.

Unlimited broadband usually means (India) you buy a specific internet plan (eg.10 Mbps) and you can download or upload all you want for the entire month, but with that speed limitation of 10mbps. However, be wary, companies like BSNL(MAHARASHTRA) have a specific FUP (fair usage policy) and after downloading or uploading beyond that Data before limit, your internet speeds will be limited, rationalized or you will invite some extra charges. ALWAYS READ YOUR ISP's terms and conditions before subscribing to an internet pack.
